context: The word 'hyvä' is a very common Finnish adjective meaning 'good'. It can be used to describe people, things, or situations. It declines depending on the case and number (singular/plural). For example, 'hyvässä' means 'in good condition', while 'hyviä' means 'good ones'. The comparative forms are 'parempi' (better) and superlative forms are 'paras' or 'parhain' (best).
